content: baby girl bling by barbara hurd these adorable bows are for babies newborn to 1 year but you could certainly add a longer elastic band for toddlers i have made three bow headbands one knitted in garter stitch with worsted wool it has 3 large french knots at the center the easiest bow is made from 2-inch wide lace and has a store-bought ribbon rosette at the center the third bow is made from calico fabric and has a rosette at the center these would make great gifts for baby showers or to mark milestones in the baby s life i made all 3 on a sunday morn it was fun i do have a bit of a mess to clean up but sometimes life s messy size actual measurement around head they stretch newborn 6 mo 1 yr or 13 5 15 16 inches gauge 18 sts/4 inches or 4 5/inch notions sewing needle and thread ½ inch wide elastic of your color choice approx 17 inches or less per band ribbon rosettes sold in small packages of 10 or so knitted bow 15 yards of worsted weight yarn size 3us needles single pointed fabric bow 6 by 11 inch rectangle of calico or other fabric this will end up being 4 layers thick to hold its shape lace bow 2-wide lace approximately 1 foot long we will start with the elastic headband cut the elastic to the measurement for your desired size 14 15 5 16 5 inches remember this will stretch slightly overlap the cut edges approximately 1/8-1/4 inch and sew together with the knots on the outside for baby s comfort this join and the knot will be covered by the bow band complete lace bow take 12 inches of lace lay it flat fold both ends overlapping in center by an inch take threaded needle and sew top to bottom in big running stitches draw the stitches together to cinch it and wrap the thread around the center twice for strength knot it to secure it then sew it over the join on the elastic band tie 2 knots to secure it sew the ribbon rosette in the center from the underside so the stitches don t show done fabric bow 11 by 6 inches this will be folded in half later iron fabric then fold in half lengthwise see pic sew both short sides and part of the long side leaving part open near the center for turning right-side-out pic shows black ink where i sewed trim fabric off of corners see them in the pic to help them look crisp when complete i used my scissors to gently poke the corners after flipping to help make them sharp be careful or you ll go through the stitches and have to sew them again iron again then stitch the opening closed invisibly well almost fold the entire piece in half shortening it to the size in the picture gather with sewing thread in center
